questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You have several Microsoft SharePoint document libraries in your on-premises environment.
You have a Microsoft 365 tenant that has directory synchronization implemented.
You plan to move all the document libraries to SharePoint Online.
You need to recommend a migration strategy for the document libraries.
Which three actions should you recommend be performed in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
The SharePoint Migration Tool lets you migrate content to SharePoint Online and OneDrive from the following locations:

SharePoint Server 2013 -

✑ SharePoint Server 2010
✑ Network and local file shares
The first step is to create new SharePoint sites in SharePoint online. These sites will host the document libraries which will host the migrated content.
The second step is to create the document libraries in the SharePoint sites to host the migrated content.
The final step is to use the SharePoint Migration Tool to migrate the content.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepointmigration/how-to-use-the-sharepoint-migration-tool

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription. All users have client computers that run Windows 10 and have Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise installed.
Some users in the research department work for extended periods of time without an Internet connection.
How many days can the research department users remain offline before they are prevented from editing Office documents?

comments.content: correct but they do not offer 180 days answer they offer 120
Is only for Entreprise with specific permission.
yes, it is 30 days by default, and from 30 uo to 180 for organizations with specific permissions, since nothing is told about that, I would choose 30 as default value

discussion.content:
It is now 180 days for enterprise 

https://office-watch.com/2021/how-to-get-microsoft-365-extended-offline-time/

Selected Answer: B
Open the linked article, search for "reduces" and it reads 30 days.
Keep it simple Bro (B)
This question was in my exam on 06/April/2022. I passed.

Default still being, 30, can be extended, extension must be configured to right value 180

Reference
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/extend-your-office-license-for-offline-use-06de5162-e230-4ce6-83bb-e6f06190a8f5?ui=en-US&rs=en-US&ad=US

questions.answer_description:
After 30 days, Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise will go into reduced functionality mode. When this happens, users will be able to open files but they won't be able to edit them.
As part of the installation process, Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise communicates with the Office Licensing Service and the Activation and Validation Service to obtain and activate a product key. Each day, or each time the user logs on to their computer, the computer connects to the Activation and Validation Service to verify the license status and extend the product key. As long as the computer can connect to the Internet at least once every 30 days, Office remains fully functional. If the computer goes offline for more than 30 days, Office enters reduced functionality mode until the next time a connection can be made.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/overview-of-licensing-and-activation-in-office-365-proplus

questions.question_text:
Your network contains an Active Directory domain. The domain contains a server named Server1 that runs Windows Server 2016. Server1 has a share named
Share1.
You have a hybrid deployment of Microsoft 365.
You need to migrate the content in Share1 to Microsoft OneDrive.
What should you use?

discussion.content: SPO migration tool! B is correct!

Selected Answer: B
Nobrainer B
Was in my exam today 05/08/22.

Selected Answer: B
B for sure
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/mailbox-migration/decide-on-a-migration-path

Answer is C:
With a hybrid migration, you can migrate the mailboxes in small batches over a period of time which will help to avoid saturating the bandwidth. With the migration wizard, you can configure a migration batch to start outside office hours which would minimize bandwidth usage during office hours.
With a hybrid migration, you do not need to reconfigure Outlook to connect to the migrated mailbox. Outlook will automatically detect the new mailbox location. This reduces administrative effort.

Selected Answer: C
>C<orrect

ahh, I get it, see over 150 so can't use cutover, its exchange 2016 so staged is not an option which by default gives us hybrid option for the win. If I did not go look this up I would have totally guessed staged incorrectly

comments.content: You can use cutover for upto 2,000 mailboxes in theory. Staged is possible on 2016, but Hybrid is the answer because it allows you to move the mailboxes in small batches at a time.

discussion.content: But I am confused by the requirement stated: "the solution must minimize administrative effort". Hybrid should be the solution with the most administrative effort.
hybrid!
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/mail-migration-jump

questions.question_text:
Your company has an on-premises Microsoft Exchange Server 2016 organization. The organization is in the company's main office in Melbourne. The main office has a low-bandwidth connection to the Internet.
The organization contains 250 mailboxes.
You purchase a Microsoft 365 subscription and plan to migrate to Exchange Online next month.
In 12 months, you plan to increase the bandwidth available for the Internet connection.
You need to recommend the best migration strategy for the organization. The solution must minimize administrative effort.
What is the best recommendation to achieve the goal? More than one answer choice may achieve the goal. Select the BEST answer.

discussion.content:
The users will be prompted to install the updates.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/office-deployment-tool-configuration-options#deadline-attribute-part-of-updates-element

Answers are:
A) Will be prompted to install several updates
B) Installed on 64-Bit version computers


The display level is set to "Full" so the user will get a normal installation experience.
Source A) https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/office-deployment-tool-configuration-options#level-attribute-part-of-display-element

I think the first is " will be prompted ": 
Prior to the deadline, users receive multiple reminders to install the updates. If Office isn't updated by the deadline, users see a notification that the updates will be applied in 15 minutes. This gives users the opportunity to save the Office documents that they're working on and to close any Office programs that are open. If users don't close the Office programs, the programs are closed automatically when the 15 minutes are up, which might result in data loss.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/office-deployment-tool-configuration-options#deadline-attribute-part-of-updates-element

Box1 should be first option, because display level is set to "full" in the configuration file. Referance: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/office-deployment-tool-configuration-options#:~:text=If%20Level%20is,normal%20installation%20experience

Box 1 should be middle option. Deadline will prompt users to install updates:

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/office-deployment-tool-configuration-options#deadline-attribute-part-of-updates-element

comments.content:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/update-channels-changes

The answer in box one is correct. Check the link.
Slight correction I mean "after the installation the user will be prompted etc. etc."

I agree, both answers are technically correct. the updates will auto install after the deadline if the user did not do it themselves. however after the update the user will also be prompted to install the updates. personally I think middle option is more correct as the last option, to me atleast, implies that once office is installed the updates are also there which is not the case. As such i'd go with middle option

But that document pretty much says that after deadline updates will be installed automatically so users won't be prompted to install.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/office-deployment-tool-configuration-options#:~:text=Prior%20to%20the%20deadline%2C%20users%20receive%20multiple%20reminders%20to%20install%20the%20updates.%20If%20Office%20isn%27t%20updated%20by%20the%20deadline%2C%20users%20see%20a%20notification%20that%20the%20updates%20will%20be%20applied%20in%2015%20minutes.

I think the answers are correct.

discussion.content: The answer for box 1 says, "When the installation is complete, all users will be prompted to install several updates" but the graphic shows "all semi-annual channel updates will be installed automatically".

comments.content: I'm going to go with what it says in the box.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
Your company has 500 client computers that run Windows 10.
You plan to deploy Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise to all the computers.
You create the following XML file for the planned deployment.
//IMG//

Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that completes each statement based on the information presented in the graphic.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Box 1:
When the installation is complete, all users will be prompted to install several updates.
In the configuration file, the Updates Enabled element is set to True. This means that Office will check for updates after the installation.
The Channel element set to Broad means that all semi-annual channel updates will be installed.
Box 2:
Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise will be installed only on the computers that run a 64-bit version of Windows 10.
The OfficeClientEdition element defines whether the 32-bit or 64-bit edition of Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise is downloaded or installed. In the configuration file, it is set to '64'. The 64-bit version will only install on a 64-bit client computer.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/configuration-options-for-the-office-2016-deployment-tool
